_**Agent**_

I'll help you fix the ESLint warnings in your Tailwind config file. Here are the necessary changes:

```typescript:tailwind.config.mjs
// Import plugins using ES modules
import tailwindAnimate from 'tailwindcss-animate';
import tailwindTypography from '@tailwindcss/typography';

/** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */
const tailwindConfig = {
  content: [
    './pages/**/*.{ts,tsx}',
    './components/**/*.{ts,tsx}',
    './app/**/*.{ts,tsx}',
    './src/**/*.{ts,tsx}',
  ],
  darkMode: ['selector', '[data-theme="dark"]'],
  plugins: [tailwindAnimate, tailwindTypography],
  // ... existing safelist ...

  theme: {
    // ... existing container config ...
    extend: {
      // ... existing animations, borderRadius, colors, fontFamily, keyframes ...
      
      typography: ({ _theme }) => ({  // Prefix unused param with underscore
        // ... rest of typography config remains the same ...
      }),
    },
  },
};

export default tailwindConfig;
```

Here are the changes made to fix the ESLint warnings:

1. Replaced `require()` calls with ES module imports for the plugins
2. Created a named constant `tailwindConfig` instead of an anonymous default export
3. Prefixed the unused `theme` parameter with underscore in the typography configuration to satisfy the unused args rule
4. Exported the named config at the end of the file

These changes should resolve all the ESLint warnings while maintaining the same functionality of your Tailwind configuration.
